channel.title: Template *HELP*
channel.description: hey i wonder how i use a template i downloaded. im using 000webhost.com

item.title: Template *HELP*
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“The Web Guy, post:3, topic:463423”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=566868.msg4120632#msg4120632 date=1349675720]
Elaborate more please. What is the template for exactly? And you will need a program like filezilla because it just makes uploading to webhost easier. You need to get the log-in credentials from the user panel on the right side of your screen when logged into 000webhost and in the actual site area.
[/quote]

I don’t think it matters much on what the template is for. The contents of the template should be in a .rar or .zip file, extracts the files to a folder on your Desktop. Then download Filezilla and launch it, the connection detail will be provided by 000webhost, somewhere on the right-hand side. After you’re connected, drag the files from your desktop to the site using Filezilla, It should be setup so that you see a index.php or index.html file in the root folder of the website. (When you first connect with filezilla)[/quote]
If it’s a template (though it wouldn’t actually be called that) for a smf theme. You have to install it via forum login, or it doesn’t work correctly. Not all templates are just for the main site.

Read full topic

item.title: Template *HELP*
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

sk8rdude461:

Elaborate more please. What is the template for exactly? And you will need a program like filezilla because it just makes uploading to webhost easier. You need to get the log-in credentials from the user panel on the right side of your screen when logged into 000webhost and in the actual site area.

I don’t think it matters much on what the template is for. The contents of the template should be in a .rar or .zip file, extracts the files to a folder on your Desktop. Then download Filezilla and launch it, the connection detail will be provided by 000webhost, somewhere on the right-hand side. After you’re connected, drag the files from your desktop to the site using Filezilla, It should be setup so that you see a index.php or index.html file in the root folder of the website. (When you first connect with filezilla)

Read full topic
